SV1.why_it_matters: Canonical design map emphasizing decentralized, harmonic, anti-singularity behaviors.
extracted_constraints: Keep decentralized flow without central controllers
Include harmonic/forgiveness guardrails to avoid runaway dynamics
Expose modular lens-inspired tuning

SV2.why_it_matters: PhaseCube ethos: influence-not-command biasing, noise/decay to prevent collapse, and minimalism.
extracted_constraints: Bias adjusts probabilities but never overwrites state
Maintain stochastic noise/decay to avoid lock-in
Keep implementation human-readable with minimal dependencies

SV3.why_it_matters: Baseline HTML showing audio-driven bias fields with Path B and ALPHA tunables.
extracted_constraints: Map inputs into decaying bias fields instead of direct control
Expose tunables for Path B probability and damping
Retain internal jitter to keep the system lively

SV4.why_it_matters: Structured audio mapping and deterministic synth start for the lattice loop.
extracted_constraints: Support influence pulses/mode switches without stale state
Permit reinitialization of grid/input cleanly
Use stereo/depth cues when converting inputs to bias

SV5.why_it_matters: Separates rendering from simulation and filters out low-energy noise while parity shapes variation.
extracted_constraints: Keep simulation logic separable from presentation/metrics
Ignore near-zero energy contributions to reduce clutter
Preserve parity noise to diversify outcomes

SV6.why_it_matters: Minimal PhaseCube rewrite confirming baseline tunables and UI-light approach.
extracted_constraints: Retain core knobs (flip, parity, Path B, ALPHA)
Avoid heavy build steps or dependencies
Favor clear loops over abstraction-heavy patterns

SV7.why_it_matters: Prior delta with lens-gated bias pulses and forgiveness in a dual-grid headless runner.
extracted_constraints: Blend lens mixer outputs into Path B and damping
Use scenario-style bias pulses that decay
Provide CLI run path and accompanying tests

SV8.why_it_matters: Manifest reinforcing modular, influence-only biasing with kenotic safeguards.
extracted_constraints: Keep bias influence-only and decaying
Include forgiveness guardrails for dispersion
Stay modular/config-driven

SV9.why_it_matters: Dual-grid browser POC with delay line, plasticity, and gentle cross-talk.
extracted_constraints: Consider dual-grid coupling with soft cross-talk
Allow delayed memory/echo influence
Expose tunables for noise and coupling

SV10.why_it_matters: Companion README stressing interpretability overlays and minimal runnable setup.
extracted_constraints: Surface metrics for interpretability
Stay dependency-light and easy to run
Document limitations/TODOs for scaling

summary: Python headless dual-grid runner with decaying bias pulses, lens-inspired gating, forgiveness damping, and tests confined to this delta.

assumptions.label: Python 3.11+ is available for running the headless simulation and tests
assumptions.rationale: Repository language mix does not declare a Python toolchain; assuming modern interpreter is acceptable to stay dependency-light.
